page.title: 01Valley of the Cubley Brook
page.content: This block consists of the villages of Cubley and Alkmonton and the northern part of the parish of Boylestone. This rural area cmprises two small compact villages with outlying mostly arable or stock farms and a few dairy farms.Nearly 3/4 of the land is fairly intensivly managed grassland providing silage, hay and grazing. The remainder is arable, barley and wheat predominate with a small area of pototoes and oil seed rape. Deciduous woodland occurs in isolated patches. Boundary hedges mosty comprise quickthorn interspersed with damson, oak, ash and elder. The land is undulating and rises gently from the book. Many residents are involved in farm work. Other inhabitants commute to neighbouring towns. FArms vary in size from under 50acres to about 200acres. Houses are generally built
